This work is taking place in Harwich Road in Thorpe Le Soken.

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 13:42 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 13:28 - Thanks for your patience this afternoon.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Faversham ME13 area and have completed their investigation. They have found grounded overhead cables. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 108 customers. There are now 43 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Roland at 12:51.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Decasta at 13:24
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the SS9 1 area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame to restore power is between 16:00-17:00, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Decasta at 13:10.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Stuart at 23:40 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but two properties in the Hinksley Road area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to repair an unexpected underground cable fault.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.

Sent by Stuart at 22:12 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers.

We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 01:05 - We can now confirm that all power in the Buckland Rise area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Stuart at 00:44
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Engineers have arrived on site to investigate what we believe to be an issue at the local substation in the Buckland Rise area. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 02:30-03:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but for more information about this type of fault; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Stuart at 00:29.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 12:42 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a fault on the underground network in the Lower Farm Road KT24 5 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused again today.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 11:40 - Our engineers have investigated and found that the power is off due to a fault on our underground electricity network which has affected our substation equipment, specialist teams are on site to pinpoint the fault and dig down to expose the cabling for repairs.

Considering the work that may be required, the revised estimated time to have the power back on is between 17:00 and 18:00.

We're sorry to change the time, but we'll keep you updated with our progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to talk on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 10:31 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. Our estimated time frame to restore power is between 14:00-15:00.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 05:51.

Hi, a final message from me, as I'm pleased to inform you that we believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 167 customers in the Wilburton CB6 3 area, by replacing a snapped pole and re erecting overhead lines following a road traffic accident.

For this reason, it's taken us longer than we expected to restore your power today. Please accept our sincere apology as we know that it is difficult to be without power for a longer duration.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To talk to us about this or anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. We're really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: It's Stuart from the text messaging team. I know you have been off for a while now and are waiting for more information. A message has been left with our staff on site, but as they work with live electricity, we need to wait until it's safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 04:20 - Our engineers have advised that the replacement pole has now been erected on site, and they are now in the process of reconnecting and carrying out repairs to the overhead lines. We will keep texting those signed up, and will continue to until the final 43 customers are restored, but if you want to stop receiving text updates please visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 22:11. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 06:49 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the Pinner HA5 3 area to investigate an underground fault currently affecting 97 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 07:00-08:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Decasta from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 12-NOV-2025 00:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 13:52. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on
